Package de.db.derpate.manager

Class LoginManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.db.derpate.manager.LoginManager
  • public class LoginManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to read and write login data (see LoginUser) to the client's HttpSession.
    Pattern: Singleton
    Author:
    MichelBlank
    See Also:
    LoginUser

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static @NonNull LoginManager instance
      Stores static instance
      private @NonNull java.lang.String userKey
      Key used to store the user in the session

      Modifier Constructor Description
      private LoginManager()
      Default constructor used for initializing attributes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static @NonNull LoginManager getInstance()
      Returns instance of LoginManager
      <T extends LoginUser>
      @Nullable T      		 getUserBySession​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Returns LoginUser that is connected with this session.
      @Nullable Usermode getUsermode​(@Nullable LoginUser user)
      Returns a Usermode, depending on the given LoginUser
      boolean isLoggedIn​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Returns current login status
      boolean isUserOfSessionInUsermode​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @Nullable Usermode... usermode)
      Checks if the user, that is logged in with the given HttpSession, is a user of the given Usermode.
      boolean login​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, @NonNull LoginUser user)
      Connects HttpSession with LoginUser
      boolean logout​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Removes connection between HttpSession and LoginUser
      private static @Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession newSession​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Destroys old session and creates a new one to prevent session hijacking.
      Should be called before every login and after every logout.
      Caution: All session attributed will be gone after this method was executed!
      void update​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @NonNull LoginUser user)
      Updates the user connected with the session.
      The id and type of user have to be the same!

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static @NonNull LoginManager getInstance()
        Returns instance of LoginManager
        Returns:
        LoginManager

      • getUserBySession

        public <T extends LoginUser> @Nullable T getUserBySession​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Returns LoginUser that is connected with this session. May return null, if user was not logged in.
        Parameters:
        session - Session of which the LoginUser should be read from
        Returns:
        LoginUser or null, if given HttpSession was null or user was not properly logged in

      • login

        public boolean login​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     @NonNull LoginUser user)
        Connects HttpSession with LoginUser
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        user - LoginUser
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false if an error occurred or given HttpServletRequest was null

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Returns current login status
        Parameters:
        session - HttpSession
        Returns:
        true, if user is logged in; false, if user is not or given HttpSession was null

      • isUserOfSessionInUsermode

        public boolean isUserOfSessionInUsermode​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                         @Nullable Usermode... usermode)
        Checks if the user, that is logged in with the given HttpSession, is a user of the given Usermode.
        Parameters:
        session - the HttpSession
        usermode - the allowed Usermodes
        Returns:
        true, if the found LoginUser is a user of the given Usermode; false, if not or no Usermode was set.

      • getUsermode

        public @Nullable Usermode getUsermode​(@Nullable LoginUser user)
        Returns a Usermode, depending on the given LoginUser
        Parameters:
        user - the LoginUser
        Returns:
        the Usermode

      • logout

        public boolean logout​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Removes connection between HttpSession and LoginUser
        Parameters:
        session - HttpSession
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false, if an error occurred or given HttpSession was null

      • update

        public void update​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                   @NonNull LoginUser user)
        Updates the user connected with the session.
        The id and type of user have to be the same!
        Parameters:
        session - the HttpSession
        user - the LoginUser to replace

      • newSession

        private static @Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpSession newSession​(@Nullable javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Destroys old session and creates a new one to prevent session hijacking.
        Should be called before every login and after every logout.
        Caution: All session attributed will be gone after this method was executed!
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        new HttpSession or null, if given HttpServletRequest was null
